review:
Super petit jeu VR. Car oui FATED est dédié uniquement au VR !

Histoire: 
Vous incarnez un guerrier blessé et muet qui revient d'entre les morts grâce à une Valkyrie. Car ou le jeu se situe bien dans la mythologie viking avec géants, valkyries et tout le tralala.
Ainsi, l'aventure démarre dans un chariot avec des compagnons avec lesquels vous pourrez échanger que par des mouvements de tête et donc de vos mouvements VR. Bien pensé pour allier le VR au geste.
Le but principal de l'aventure sera d'échapper aux géants qui vous pourchassent et franchement ce sera épique! Course poursuites avec votre chariot dans une descente, temple à explorer, tir à l'arc, etc... Le tout bien sur saupoudré par la VR.

Gameplay: La VR révolutionne le genre. De plus, ce petit jeu a franchement été bien pensé pour ce mode. Vous devrez à un moment traverser un pont au dessus du vide et gare aux vertiges. Sensations incroyables au rendez vous ! Sinon, vous ne pourrez pas controler votre personnage comme dans n'importe quel RPG. Il y a des phases dans chaque chapitre qui débloquent certaines fonctionnalités de mouvement comme la possibilité de courir, utiliser votre arc, etc... C'est donc trés linéaire et basé plus sur l'observation scénaristique que l'action.

Graphismes: Cartoonesques pour résumer. Cependant, attention aux nombreux bugs graphiques, on sent que les développeurs ont eu du mal avec la VR. Lags, problémes d'affichage en profondeur, etc...

Durée de vie: 2 heures à tout casser. Il y a 5 chapitres possédant tous une phase d'action intense. Cette courte durée de vie s'explique par le fait que ce jeu ne représente qu'une introduction à un jeu bien plus intense. Malheureusement, le jeu ne semble pas avoir convaincu surtout en raison de son prix de départ jugé exhorbitant par rapport au contenu offert. Alors que le jeu est sorti en 2016, aucune suite n'est d'actualité en 2023 et c'est bien dommage car il y avait un énorme potentiel.

Difficulté: Aucune, clairement.

Prix: Aujourd'hui, en soldes vous pouvez l'obtenir à moins de 5 euros. Ne le prenez surtout pas plus cher.

Fated est donc un trés bon petit jeu si vous voulez avoir une expérience VR, sachez cependant que le jeu était une introduction à un jeu bien plus grand qui ne verra probablement jamais le jour ou pas avant un moment, donc ne vous attendez pas à avoir une conclusion satisfaisante à la fin du jeu. Au contraire !

review:
One of the fantastic experiences in VR still playable and fun in 2022. This game is from 2016, perhaps it might have been developed before, at Oculus DK times. Because, touch controllers are not supported, even though it is first person view and based on full body presence. Sounds weird, right? You control your hands with a gamepad and  a head-based pointer. And actually, it works well once you accept that it is ok. After all, how could we complain when everything works fine and if they did this game in the very early days of vr? By the way, these mechanics reminded me of Ascent Spirit VR, which would make way more sense if touch controllers were supported. So, it is not alone :)

Walking is so slow. Luckily, there is no need to rush since you can be busy with enjoying the beautiful art style. 

The textures seem beautifully crafted and hand-painted.

The gameplay is very easy. Unfortunately, the content is very small in terms of gameplay. I liked the horse carriage driving part the most. Beside, there are a few small puzzles, a few platforming, and a few bow shooting for like, less than a tutorial length. 

So, it is mostly an experience based on a story. For me, it is more for enjoying the visual art style in VR. The story is always not as cute as its visual style. It is not a complete melancholic story though, but it has some tragic moments based on losses. I think it deserves a better end or continuation.

review:
Pros:
Interesting story
Decent cartoonish graphics

Cons:
Very short (took me ~2 hours)
Not very immersive having to use a controller
Ends without warning on a cliffhanger

Not being able to use the standard touch inputs was very frustrating and limited the interactivity (using my Meta Quest 2).  It worked well enough for it's design, but made the movement feel very stiff and distant.  I was enjoying the story and the pretty atmosphere (forest, caves, mountains) but ending the way it did was very disappointing.  If the game used regular touch inputs and actually finished the story then I would have recommended it.  In it's current state and without any mention of a sequel it's hard to recommend.  I got it as part of a bundle, but I wouldn't pay more than $5 otherwise.

review: I didn't have any technical issues, and it was all very slick for what it was. Put simply this is a very pretty (models, textures, lighting, atmosphere) mini-narrative adventure. I can't say the narrative is that compelling but it's slick enough to play through from start to finish in one session, and as long as you haven't paid too much for it that's fine. The real shame is that it's got a very dated control scheme that slows things down and creates some occasional frustration. It's really not enough of a game to warrant sending you back to re-do things if you fail. SO it might as well be easier to control and just let you experience it. I enjoyed it... but more as a narrative short with some far too simple gameplay to call it much of a game. Enjoy it, and then move on. You won't find many games this pretty in VR.

review:
A beautiful hour-long narrative experience which in my opinion has held up magnificently, even 5 years later. 

Unfortunately the ending is abrupt, unearned, and does not follow through on or explain a worryingly large amount of narrative promises. It turns what was until that point a gorgeous and impactful VR game into a confusing and disappointing experience, and really makes it seem like the devs had intended this to be one game in a series of instalments. Once I had that realisation, I began searching for news of a sequel and found that a second episode had been planned years ago and even made significant progress, but never materialised for unknown reasons. 

Out of curiosity, I checked and saw that they seem to have plenty projects, with the most recent announcement a few months ago being that they were helping work on the Harry Potter themed Pokemon Go clone (sorry Frima, I'm not trying to devalue your work, Warner Bros just doesn't have a single original bone in its body). I understand that sometimes a dev studio has no choice but to go where money is or wherever publishers might need them and I genuinely wish them the best, but disappointed is not the word I'd use to describe how much it sucks that the Fated IP and the plot it very effectively tried to start does not and likely never will go anywhere.

review: First all I think this was a very enjoyble experience and it looks crystal sharp on my Valve Index. I definitely like this. Yes, it is short and yes the controls are very rudimentary. Probably the game was designed rather for startes in VR than for all those VR FPS experts that can stomach everything. Well, here is then also the one of the only real problems I had. I was playing the game in a seated position and with a controller. This is for me the best recipe for nausea. Imagine this, feeling a bit ill in a game that has been designed to be be a total VR starter product... therefore, for the future I would recommend a standing position / or seated and definitely make use of the motion controllers. Remember the game is from 2016, so from the very beginning of VR gaming. So the game is excused. We should always keep the development into perspective. Therefore I really enjoyed this interactive walking simulator. Even being short and slow I had the desire to finish it and this is what I also did. For me this is a recommendation. Good VR starter game.

review:
[h1]Experienced on the Oculus Rift with Xbox One Controller[/h1]

You can view my review & gameplay here: https://youtu.be/wSPPcWNM1cw

It took me a little less than 80 minutes to finish this game. It's really a walking simulator for VR, mostly cinematic, narrative-driven experience. Unfortunately, the game ends abruptly as though the developer ran out of funds to finish the story. 

That's too bad because this could have been an amazing VR experience. It's still recommendable but you do have to look past the fact that it's an unfinished game. There are high production values here. Even though this game is from 2016, the visuals are top notch. The game ran smoothly for me on my 1060 GTX.

The puzzles, action sequences, & platforming were all a bit too basic and not much of a challenge. However, the focus was clearly on the story and it's a good one .. up until the abrupt ending which does leave a bad taste in your mouth. It's also a bad ending (although it could easily be fixed with another chapter to the story). 

I bought this game in a bundle and can easily recommend it. Apparently, there was to be another chapter but that's probably not going to happen since it's been pending since 2016 already. I would have loved to have seen the story finished and motion controls being implemented (game would have benefited a lot from this).

[b]Rate 6.5/10. [/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561197970945132', 'num_games_owned': 395, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 93, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1576122223}
review:
I picked this game up in a bundle for next to nothing.  It actually looked interesting but I went months without trying it because for some inexplicable reason it requires (and willl only work with) a gamepad.  I understand that this is a 2016 title, but I still find it disappointing that the developer never got around to patching this.  I knew going in that this was a seated experience as well and that didn't impact my negative rating.

I hadn't even watched the trailer or looked at screenshots when I fired this up so I really had no expectations.  Once in the game, I was pleasantly surprised.  Make no mistake, this is a very early VR title and the seated-only gameplay coupled with gamepad control certainly make that clear.  But the graphics and story initially indicated that it might be neat little game.

Unfortunately that feeling didn't last long.  The motion sickness caused by turning with the gamepad is extremely intense.  I have an i7-8700 & gtx 1080 GPU...my rig can easily handle this game.  There's just something SERIOUSLY wrong with how the game engine handles moving.  I almost never get sick in VR, but this thing really, really made me want to vomit.

Honestly, it's too bad because there's no reason why this shouldn't be a decent little game.  The developer put some effort into the graphics and I won't criticize the voice acting.  There's absolutely some enjoyable stuff here...but my god, the turning will make you want to vomit, and that's not hyperbole.  Not only can I not recommend Fated, I recommend you avoid playing it even if you get it for free unless you just want to get sick.

UPDATE:  I have gone back to revisit this title and put more time in.  My opinion has not changed dramatically.  Fated is basically an on-the-rails type game with some puzzles and timed sequences, but they have some charm and can be enjoyable.  But the motion sickness is undeniable.  I have no idea what's going on with that.  Few other titles really make me queasy, but there's something unusual going on with Fated, even on my modern hardware.  I suppose I'd retract my earlier comment to avoid it if you get it for free--that is far too harsh since it is a cute little game.  At most, maybe acqquire it in a bundle with some other games that you actually want.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987588169', 'num_games_owned': 2195, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 74, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1523226327}
review:
Dieses Spiel sollte jeder zumindest ein Mal gespielt haben. Es ist zwar nur in englischer Sprache verfügbar, aber die gesprochenen Texte sind nicht wirklich komplex und jeder Hauptschulabbrecher sollte das verstehen.
Die Geschichte ist sehr einfühlsam und bindet einen sofort ins Geschehen ein.
Was aber wirklich fasziniert sind die Ideen, die hier eingebracht wurden. Der "Riese", der darin vorkommt, haut einen in VR wirklich fast vom Stuhl und hinterlässt einen bleibenden Eindruck über einen großen Teil des Spiels.

Die Animationen sind größtenteils gut gemacht. Anfangs hatte ich Bedenken, dass sich durch die Egoperspektive ein Schwindelgefühl entwickeln könnte, was aber über das gesamte Spiel (was ca. 70 Minuten dauert) nicht entwickelte. Das Spiel ist sehr angenehm zu spielen und die Steuerung geht leicht von der Hand.
Die Grafik ist sehr ansprechend in einer Art Manga-Comic-Stil mit großen Augen der Protagonisten geprägt und daher sehr interessant und mal etwas anderes.

Das Ende ist etwas abrupt gestaltet und lässt auf eine Fortsetzung hoffen. Aber ich fühlte mich keineswegs enttäuscht durch das Ende. Es war zwar etwas unvorhersehbar, was dem Ganzen aber ansich einen guten Nachgeschmack hinterlässt.

Alles in Allem finde ich diese Erfahrung sehr impulsiv und extrem ideenreich.
Jeder, der eine HMD besitzt sollte das zumindest ein Mal gespielt haben.

Das Spiel ist allerdings eher als interaktiver Film zu sehen. Was dem Ganzen aber keinen Abbruch beschert, sondern genau die feine Würze gibt, die diese Art von Spiel benötigt.

[list]
[*]The story is incomplete, like this is just the first of many chapters. It's a good start, but it's just a start.
[*]Very short, like everyone points out. There are four acts, and each is only about 20 minutes long. I can see why the folks who paid $20 would be pretty annoyed, but 10 bucks seems a fair price.
[*]There are some pretty boring sections - act 1 in particular I found really dull.
[*]Animations are a little stiff, and many of the voicelines have unnaturally long/uniform pauses between them, which makes things feel robotic at times.
[*]It's  mostly narrative, so there's no replay value.
[/list]

Another pro or con (depending on how you look at it) is this game is pretty light on actual gameplay. A good deal of the experience is walking around, listening to other characters talk, and looking at the sights on mostly linear paths. I didn't mind, and there are some fun action sequences and other gameplay moments to mix things up, but if you're looking for something action-packed, this isn't it.

Overall I liked it enough to hope they're able to continue the story in future installments.

review:
Historia o klanie Vikingów, który musi przetrwać próby przygotowane przez bogów. Klanie zdziesiątkowanym przez niejasne katastrofy, który opierając swoją siłę na rodzinie, próbuje przetrwać trudny czas. Wcielamy się w głowę tej rodziny i musimy przeprowadzić ich do bezpiecznego miejsca.

Gra nie jest zła, ale ma zdecydowanie za długi wstęp i za dużo momentów, w których idziemy do przodu - po prostu idziemy nie mogąc tego nijak przyspieszyć. Pozwala nam się to zżyć z naszą wirtualną rodzinką, ale bardzo mocno nudziło.

Na szczęście VR uratował tą grę i było parę momentów (szkoda że tylko parę) które wynagrodziły mi powolne człapanie dużego vikinga, w którego się wcieliłam. Nie chcę więc hejtować, szczególnie, że gierka była krótka, w miarę ładna i miała sensowne przesłanie.

author: {'steamid': '76561198261319905', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 127, 'last_played': 1491768263}
review:
Alles in allem kann ich FATED: The Silent Oath Adventure-Fans, die auf Spiele wie beispielsweise The Walking Dead von Telltale Games stehen, durchaus empfehlen. Leider verschenkt das Spiel unglaublich viel Potenzial, sodass es am Ende einfach nur ein mittelmäßiges bis gutes Spiel ist, dessen Kauf ich allerdings für knapp 10 Euro trotzdem nicht bereue.

[u][b]Positiv:[/b][/u]
[b]+ Grafik:[/b] Die Grafik ist zwar technisch nicht unbedingt beeindruckend, künstlerisch allerdings sehr gut umgesetzt. Die Welt wirkt einfach stimmig und es macht Spaß sich in ihr aufzuhalten. Auch die Charaktere passen sehr gut in das Setting. Darüber hinaus sind einige Passagen des Spiels sehr gut inszeniert.
[b]+ Länge:[/b] Das Spiel geht zwar nur knapp 1 ½ Stunden, ist aber auch bei weitem kein Vollpreisspiel. Verglichen mit anderen VR-Spielen ist das durchaus gut. Doch selbst im Vergleich zu anderen Non-VR Episoden-Spielen sind 1 ½ Stunden durchaus in Ordnung für eine Episode.
[b]+ Ton:[/b] Ganz klar sehr gut. Gerade die Musik finde ich persönlich sehr stimmungsvoll und passend gewählt.
[b]+ Story:[/b] Die Story macht auf mich einen (sehr) interessanten Eindruck und man möchte wirklich wissen wie es weitergeht. Leider ist das Ende sehr offen (siehe Kritikpunkt weiter unten).

[u][b]Negativ:[/b][/u]
[b]- Interaktion:[/b] Das Spiel unterstützt nur das Gamepad als Interaktionsmöglichkeit (mal abgesehen vom gelegentlichen Kopfnicken oder Kopfschütteln). Dabei wäre es prädestiniert für die Unterstützung von Motion Controllern.
[b]- Bewegung:[/b] Auch unterstützt das Spiel nur das Gamepad als einzige Bewegungsform. Bekannte Fortbewegungskonzepte wie etwa Teleportation werden nicht unterstützt. Selbst das freie bewegen im Raum (room-scale) wird nicht unterstützt. Das führte zumindest bei mir zu einem leichten Unwohlsein.
[b]- Synchronisation:[/b] Es gibt weder eine deutsche Synchronisation noch deutsche Untertitel. Für viele Spieler sicher zu verschmerzen. Ich bevorzuge allerdings für die volle Immersion immer noch die Deutsche Sprache.
[b]- Ende:[/b] Das Spiel hört eigentlich mittendrin auf. Wie weiter oben schon angedeutet erweckt das Spiel den Anschein eines Episoden-Adventures. Allerdings existiert nun fast ein Jahr nach Veröffentlichung immer noch kein Lebenszeichen einer zweiten Episode was für mich eher den Anschein erweckt, dass es hier nie eine zweite Episode geben wird.
[b]- Entscheidungen:[/b] Das Spiel gibt einem zwar die Möglichkeit durch Kopfnicken oder Kopfschütteln gelegentlich Entscheidungen zu treffen doch haben diese soweit ich das beurteilen kann kaum bzw. keine Auswirkungen auf den weiteren Spielverlauf. Das ist zwar bei Episoden-Spiele in der aller ersten Episode gar nicht so unüblich (da die Konsequenzen dann erst in den späteren Episoden folgen), doch falls es hier keine weiteren Episoden geben sollte senkt das den Wiederspielwert enorm.

Fairerweise sie natürlich angemerkt das viele (bzw. die ersten drei) der oben genannten Kritikpunkte genauso auf der Steam-Sete kommuniziert werden und man so eigentlich auch keine bösen Überraschungen erleben sollte. Trotzdem bleibt es in meinen Augen enorm verschrecktes Potenzial. Das Spiel hätte ohne die oben genannten Kritikpunkte um ein Vielfaches besser sein können und zu einem echten Highlight unter den VR-Spielen werden können. Wer allerdings mit den Kritikpunkten leben kann bekommt trotzdem eine gute Unterhaltung für knapp 1 ½ Stunden.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010713566', 'num_games_owned': 302, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1498873199}
review:
FATED: The Silent Oath is a great idea with okay execution.

I cried a few times through the story, the story is great, the voice acting I found to be sufficient to draw the player in. 

The motion sickness was managable but compared to others I seem to have a decent tolerance. 

What was an issue for me was a couple of the control mechanics and the character pathing.

There were multiple times an NPC was standing infront of me looking at me, I assumed they wanted to speak however I was simply standing in their way and this wasnt clear. This was a bit annoying as I was standing there looking at them expecting dialogue.

Second the controls could use some tweaking, the comfort options are great but what would have made this game would have been motion controls and idle interactions.

Multiple times I wanted to reach out and pat Lif on the head, I reached for Svens torch before he was able to hand it to me or I wanted to take Freyas hand when we sat next to eachother. Small things that could have been done with the current controls.

I hope in future chapters motion controls will be implemented.

Lastly many seem to have issue with the freelook/body turning motion they used in the game. This could be remedied with a snap body to head orientation control such as clicking a thumbstick.



PROS:
Story is heart-wrenching and convincing
The visuals are pretty
Voice acting added to the game rather than detracted

CONS:
Lack of motion controls
Control scheme and mechanics could be improved
Interaction with NPCs could improve

The game is only 9.99 and I would say though short, it is worth it. I look forward to the next chapter. I know the developers can improve upon the mechanics and I want to see where the story goes.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970371390', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 95, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1478378043}
review:
Where this "game" shines is the characters. They are well animated, voiced and just feel very real despite the very cartoony style (or maybe because of it). In this regard it is probably one of the best VR experiences at the moment and for that reason I would also recommend it.

BUT: 

1) This is not really a game. There are a few puzzles and a few parts where you have a slight interaction with the world, but for the most part you push forward on your gamepad to progress along the extremely linear levels and navigate to the right spots (which are even highlighted) so the next scripted sequence can start. I felt especially cheated in the ending sequence which is somewhat dramatic and you soon realize that the control you are given during that sequence is completely meaningless. Personally I think the developers could have made a completely non-interactive experience out of it and it would have worked better.

2) The story is pretty forgettable and the "game" ends at a point where the prologue of a normal story driven game would end. I.e. the premise of the story might be interesting, but you don't really get much more than the premise.

In summary: Buy the game because it shows what might be possible in VR in the future (esp. regarding emotional attachment to virtual characters), but don't expect a teriffic story or an actual game.

O trailer não faz juz a ambientação do jogo, que é um RV bem imersivo. 
Não é um Skyrin adaptado nas coxas, não me causou nauses.
Em fim, é uma ótima experiência com uma narrativa suave e interessante.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016017687', 'num_games_owned': 989, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 76, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1468112678}
review:
Die Steam-Bewertungen sprechen leider für sich und zeigen deutlich, wie niedrig die Toleranzgrenze bei uns Spielern sein kann. Doch das hat FATED nicht verdient.

Nehmt euch doch bitte Zeit und gebt dem Team des Frima Studios eine Chance. Euch erwartet eine Reise durch das mythologische Wikingerzeitalter, in dem sich eure Taten als Vater, Ehemann und Stammesführer wunderbar dramatisch abzeichnen – auf ein ungewöhnliches Ende zuführend, das einen Nachfolger unabdingbar macht. Grafik sowie Akustik sind wirklich aus einem Guss und entführen euch in ein fremdes Land.

Wenn da nicht die kurze Spielzeit und unvermeidlich unglücklich gewählte Locomotion wären, wäre Fated ein Meisterwerk. So ist es „nur“ seine knapp 20€ auf alle Fälle wert.

Unsere umfassende Review findet ihr hier: http://www.vr-freaks.de/?p=231

author: {'steamid': '76561197986966764', 'num_games_owned': 1923, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 81, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1467464758}
review:
어드벤처 퍼즐 형식의 vr게임입니다.

주인공은 죽다 살아난 대신 목소리를 잃어버립니다. 그리고 그 상태로 게임이 시작되는데요.

그 때문에 플레이 전반에 걸쳐 NPC들이 물어보는 말에 고개를 끄덕이는 것과 좌우로 흔드는 것으로 나름의 의사표현을 할 수 있습니다.
어느쪽을 선택하던 비슷한 스토리로 이어지기에 선택에 기로가 얼만큼 중요한 작용을 하는지 잘 모르겠네요.

처음엔 어느 타이밍인지도 몰라서 아무 반응없는 철벽남 플레이를 했는데, 후에 효과음을 확인하고서야 매끄러운 진행을 할 수 있었습니다.

플레이 초반에 활을 쏘기도 하는데 솔직히 그걸로는 어떤 싸움도 못합니다.
그저 이런걸 할 수 있다는 걸 보여주는 정도...?

게임 내에서 가족을 상당히 강조하는 느낌인데 그게 의외로 마지막에 몰입감을 줍니다.

전체적으로 조금 부족하고 심심한 느낌을 주는 게임이지만 그래도 초기 VR 어드벤처 게임으로썬 상당히 높은 퀄리티라고 할 수 있겠습니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030508562', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1469027505}
review:
I played this on the HTC Vive. There is not quite 1.5 hours of material and gameplay is fairly minimal, but that's not necessarily a problem as I quite like interactive fiction games such as Gone Home and To the Moon and such.

I recommend for extra immersion that if you have a Vive to match the stance of the protagonist (sitting, standing, crawling etc) and using the recenter view button liberally.

Upsides:
- Highly polished
- Beautiful visuals
- Well written dialogue
- Good voice acting
- An intriguing story

Downsides:
- Not optimsed for Vive, which is a shame as there are sections that would feel really good with the vive controllers.
- A little motion sickness towards the end, but this was solved by switching the turning mode to snap rotate.
- Unsatisying ending.
- Expensive for what you get. Compare with Call of the Starseed for example.

Overall though, I can recommend this game, even if some of the other Vive titles do outshine it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198216192173', 'num_games_owned': 338, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 114, 'last_played': 1468254597}
review:
Wenn es eine Grafik Demo bzw. VR Demo wäre, würde ich einen Daumen nach oben geben.
Die Atmosphäre ist stimmig, der Gesamteindruck sehr gut, obwohl sich die Figuren etwas hölzern bewegen und der VR - Effekt besser ist als bei vielen anderen Spielen.
Vor allem dachte ich, als ich das Spiel angefangen habe: Endlich mal ein Game abseits des ganzen Arcade Mist, der so angeboten wird.
Der Ansatz der Story ist recht interessant und man möchte schon wissen wie es weiter geht...
Jedoch nach nicht mal zwei Stunden Spielzeit kommt der Abspann! 
Ich dachte schon ich hätte etwas falsch gemacht bzw die "Endaufgabe" nicht bestanden. Also spielte ich die letzte Mission drei mal, weil ich nicht glauben konnte, dass gerade als es anfing interessant zu werden, das Spiel zu Ende sein soll...

Deswegen kann ich leider keinen Daumen nach oben geben, da das Spiel viel zu kurz ist, als dass wirkliche Spannung entsteht oder eine gute Story erzählt wird.
Schade, verschwendetes Potenzial...

author: {'steamid': '76561198033903290', 'num_games_owned': 1194, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 72, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 72, 'last_played': 1468626548}
review:
FATED ist eine Art interaktiver Film. Man kann zwar herumlaufen und muss auch hin und wieder etwas tun, aber alles in allem bleibt es eher eine Art interkative Abenteuererfahrung.

Die Figuren sind sehr gut "gezeichnet" und geben der Geschichte einen sehr schönen Comic-Anstrich, der einfach nur Spass macht. Die Geschichte selbst handelt um eine nordische Familie, die sich in Sicherheit bringen muss.

Als VR-Erfahrung ist FATED auf jeden Fall sehenswert, wenn auch leider sehr, sehr kurz.
Auch machen die Handlungen nicht immer Sinn (warum man z.Bsp. Bogen schießen lernt ist und bleibt ein Rätsel) und einige Teile der Geschichte eröffnen sich im Moment noch nicht.
Ich denke aber, dass dies in weiteren Teilen noch erklärt oder mehr Sinn ergeben wird.

Die Laufgeschwindigkeit ist teilweise sehr müsig, gerade wenn man durch lange Gänge gehen muss und gefühlt einfach nicht vorran kommt.

Ich habe insgesamt ca. 70 Minuten durch das Spiel gebraucht und finde daher die 20 Euro etwas übertrieben. In einem Kinofilm bekomme ich für das Geld noch etwas zu essen und auch mehr Story. Aber das ist leider der Preis, den man aktuell für VR zahlen muss.

Trotz allem finde ich das Spiel sehr gut und es hat mich gut unterhalten.

Motion Sickness hatte ich nur am Anfang beim umdrehen. Das langsame Laufen scheint das Übelkeitsgefühl zu nehmen. Allerdings ist dies immer eine sehr persönliche Sache, wie anfällig man beim Laufen im sitzen ist ;).
Bei mir hat es einige Zeit gedauert, bis ich das relativ gut ertragen konnte (in anderen Spielen). Für Leute, die sonst nur Vive spielen wird dies natürlich eine arge Umstellung sein. Allerdings gibt es hier einige Komfortfunktionen, die es etwas leichter machen sollen (Snap-Mode für Rückartiges drehen und diverse Orientierungspunkte, damit es beim Gehen etwas leichter wird.

Das Spiel ist (zumindest im Moment noch) vollständig in Englisch gehalten. Es gibt auch keine Untertitel. Wer es spielt sollte also einigermaßen gesprochenes Englisch verstehen können.

Fazit:
Im Grunde eine sehr gute Erfahrung, mit einigen Schwächen, die vielleicht aber in folgenden Teilen ausgebügelt werden. 
Da der Preis für die Spielzeit sehr hoch ist, empfehle ich hier auf ein Steam-Angebot zu warten, damit man nicht enttäuscht ist. Außerdem sollte man relativ unempfindlich gegen sitzendes Laufen sein.

author: {'steamid': '76561198117023675', 'num_games_owned': 463, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 76, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1468436504}
review:
Kurzes aber sehr gut gemachtes Spiel. Naja eingentlich eher eine art interaktiver Film. Trotzdem echt sehenswert. Wür alle die auch in VR mal etwas anderes als Highscore-Jagd machen wollen. 

Die Grafik und die Effekte kommen in VR sehr gut rüber. Die Geschichte ist liebevoll inszeniert. Das ganze Spiel ist aber nur auf Englisch und man sollte das auch recht gut können, sonst geht viel von der Atmospere verloren. 

Ich habe zwar nur etwas mehr als eine Stunde zum Durchspielen gebraucht, aber in der Zeit überraschend viel erlebt und gesehen. Der Wiederspielwert ist aber relativ gering. 

Bin trotzdem auf den nächsten Teil gespannt und werde ihn mir auch sicher wieder kaufen. 

Achtung für alle VIVE Nutzer: Das Spiel wird mit dem Gamepad und nicht mit den VIVE-Kontrollern gespielt. Wer das doof findet sollte die Finger davon lassen. 

Von mir aber Daumen hoch, insbesondere wegen der Atmosprere und dem "polierten" Gesamteindruck.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024469112', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 81, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1466953099}
review:
If you are disappointed about the lack of story telling games in VR, this shows you the potential how it could look like. 

Its very short, but the voiceacting and sounds are good and the graphics are one of the best until now (I have over 65 VR Games played, only a few are on this level).
The story would be boring on a normal 2D screen, but here you get sucked into the world and story.

However, it has a few downsides:
-If you dont have your VR Legs yet, you might feel discomfort while moving.
-Very short
-Chapter one is very slow, the game begins to kick in with chapter two.
-A lot of slow walking (not realy a negative for me, but for impatient persons)

Besides that it has great moments.

If you want more storytelling in VR you should buy this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025033642', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 75, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1466878946}
review:
Is...is that the end? Some of the comments seem to indictate that this is en episodic thing, but I've found nothing from the creators that suggest that. If that is the end of the story, then I'm angry, and I dont get angry easily. And I'm not saying that because it is a relatively pricey game that is only an hour long, I'm saying that because it has one of those endings that is done so poorly that you actually get angry. Absolutely no resolution. [spoiler] You're brought back to life at the beginning of the game to protect someone's life. You fail. The end. You dont know why the person was important enough to warrant reviving the dead to protect them and you dont see any consequences that arise as a result of your failure. They die, end. And they die in a way that is not at all plot-relevant. The game literally ends in the middle of a dungeon.[/spoiler]

 Aside from that, I found that many of the other reviews were spot-on. The game has its good moments, but the characters all have these big-soulless eyes that give an uncanny valley vibe, the voice acting is just as wooden as the characters, and the walking speed is way too slow. The NPCs even walk faster than you! And they can run, too! If I ever learn that this is not, in fact, the end of the game, then I will remove this review. But until then, I cant reccommend this game to anyone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198092587756', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 80, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1466787670}
review:
The agonizingly slow walking speed is a deal breaker.  

For a game that falls into the 'walking simulator' category, it needs to give the illusion of options, choices, and exploration.  This means you need to be able to walk around a bit and explore your surroundings - even though ultimately you will be sheparded into the next scene since that is really the only place to go.

When you can only walk at 2mph like in this game, nobody has the patience to try and walk around to look at anything.  So you just walk in straight lines from one thing to the next.

Game is very short.  Granted, I walked mainly in straight lines to the next thing, but still, 80 minutes total.  If you explore a little more, you're still definitely less than 2 hours.

For graphics, the characters look good - the ground looks awful.  Ground textures are super low resolution and have no life to them at all, so flat.

review:
More experience than game, but a fun way to explore VR. The characters and scenery are gorgeous, and you get to experiment, mostly on your own pace, with controller movement. This may bring some discomfort with it, especially rotation, but the devs have included a nubmer of helpers in the game (reference objects; speed control) to help you adapt to movement in a virtual world.

The story was engaging and I found myself caring about the characters very quickly into the game. Yes, it's short, but it's kind of like experiencing a movie. I do recommend you pick this one up if you like narrative and a slower pace. Check out my full review on GeekDad: https://geekdad.com/2016/06/3-minute-vr-fated-the-silent-oath/

review:
This is a good experience for a studio who makes his very first VR game. The narrative aspect of the game is a very good choice and make you want to protect the family and make you feel sad when someone you know died. But, there's a lot to improve for the next episode. 

PRO:
- Good story and narrative experience
- The graphic are nice
- The adventure on road and controlling the horse is a very good experience for VR

CONS:
- You can just walk (you can't run), so the game is slow
- Should simplify the game to use HTC or Oculus Controller
- Should be a standing experience with room-scale (see game: The Gallery)
- A teleport system like "Valve: The Lab" can be usefull to explore the environnement
- Can't see thinks far away in the environnement with actual resolution on HMD. Should think to work with smaller environnement for this constraint.

review:
从 2015 年 2 月开始，开发团队 Frima 工作室开写《宿命》的开发博客。

“和大多数人一样，我第一次接触虚拟现实用的是 Oculus Rift DK1，玩的是过山车体验。小伙伴在旁边一直嘲笑我，当时我腿软的不行不行的。”——Frima 工作室执行制片人文森特·马特尔（Vincent Martel ）

时隔一年多， Frima 工作室在今天发布了《宿命》第一章《宿命：无声的誓言》的预告片，并宣布这款游戏将在 4 月 28 号上线，同时支持 Oculus、HTC Vive、PlayStation VR 三大平台。

《宿命：无声的誓言》是 Frima 工作室第一部 VR 作品，总部位于加拿大魁北克市。迄今为止，他们已经开发出了 12 款大型多人在线游戏、80 多款手机游戏和超过 200 部的网页小游戏。因此被誉为加拿大增长最快的游戏公司之一。

游戏背景坐落在维京人的时代，讲了一个有关勇气和牺牲的北欧神话故事。

北欧神话的世界观是个多神的系统，大致有四个体系：巨人（Giants）、诸神（Gods）、精灵（Elves）以及侏儒（Dwarves）。

巨人是最早出现的生命，在游戏中充当大坏蛋的角色。

而我们帅气的男主角（也就是玩家要扮演的角色）Ulfr 要保护家人，抵抗古代巨人的袭击和骚扰。

Ulfr 的职业是古代的木匠。他有一位美丽的妻子 Freja，是个有主见、善良的女性。

就算全世界与她为敌，她也要坚持她认为正确的事情，比如嫁给 Ulfr。

他们还有一个可爱的女儿 Lif，都说爱笑的女孩运气不会太差。

这么满满正能量的一家人却不得不逃离破败的家园，开启全新的冒险之路。

Frima 工作室选了虚拟4引擎开发这款游戏，所有的开发历程和经验都分享在他们的博客中，包括这一年来设计的过程、制作的过程，还有一长串我看不懂的代码。

《宿命：无声的誓言》完全以故事情节取胜，所以没有复杂的操作性以及重重关卡。

但当你沉浸其中， 肩负起身为一个男人的责任时，复杂的情感冲突会引领着玩家一直探索下去。

我们看看外媒的评价：

“《宿命》真的很惊人，问题是你们不会相信我说的。”——Polygon

“连接、爱、恐惧、激动。《宿命》让我沦陷，那也只是轻描淡写的说法。”——RoadToVR

“《宿命》是一款第一人称 VR 游戏，它将剧情与动作完美结合。”——VRFocus

文森特·马特尔说：“在虚拟现实中，让人感到恐惧是很容易的事情，但我们希望能让人们在 VR 中感受到快乐和悲伤，通过这个游戏连接与家人之间的情感。没有什么比父母与孩子之间的联系更强了，我们注定会撩拨玩家敏感的心弦。”

除了感人的亲情，游戏在预告片中也标榜了暴力与血腥，未成年的小孩子不要玩哦！玩了也不要说是我推荐的哦！

然而，暴力与血腥只供我们自己想象了。

最后，我们下一个 VR 游戏的评测界面见！！

review:
This game I personally enjoyed, but I am a story driven atmospheric game type person. It is short, and the price may be an issue for some. 

When I started, it spun me out, the colours, the characters, but when I began moving I became nausious, only when turning though. I never get motion sickness so this was concering. I ended up changhed to snap turn and that fixed the motion sickness I was getting.

Yes the story is short, but  considering it's one of the longer games on vive I've played I was actually quite surprised. Some games are 8$ for 15 minutes of play, so consider that when buying this game. It's also the first episode, and I can't wait for the second, as in most stories they take you to the point of no return and leave you hanging there.

To summerise this game, for me it was pretty. There isn't a lot to do in the way of interaction, but again I enjoyed sitting back and watching the story unfold. If you're a hands on person then this likely isn't for you. but if your a fantasy nerd like myself you may find it ropes you in. 

Note, I also have a bad back, and I was able to sit and play this game, which was very appealing to me.

Hope you enjoy it.

review:
going to quote tornare, as he is exatly on point with how i feel:

"My issue is the price. If it were $20 for all future episodes it would be a great deal, but from what i understand we paid $20 for what is a 1.5 hour game. If all episodes end up costing the same, then this will end up being a VERY expensive game once they finish every episode, and its clearly not worth that much.

I have some other minor complaints like Walking seems a little slower then it should be, but overall i did enjoy the game. It is fairly well polished. Its a bit of a walking simulator, with a few puzzles, but the story keeps flowing. The giant actually makes your heart beat because in VR its legit scary.

I can't downvote a game i enjoyed, but i do feel the price is too high for one short episode. As much as i like roomscale games with motion controls I have zero complaints about the lack of motion controls because the game works fine with a Xbox controller while sitting down. Not every game needs to use every feature on the Vive to be good."

My additional thoughts:

I think the game is beautiful, and the characters are great, i just think this episodic release trend for partial games at high prices will tend to hurt VR sales as a whole.
Right now all VR games are either poorly optiumized ports or highly tuned Demos, and they both are not really worth the money being asked.

That all being said, if you think of this as a "cinematic experiance" like going to the movies, then its worth the asking price, and it really is a fancy "interactive" movie more than a game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024895531', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 90, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 84, 'last_played': 1463534129}
review:
Played on a DK2 with Oculus' 1.3 Runtime.

This game is visually stunning, the low-poly environment is brought up to almost Dreamworks/Pixar levels by the excellent texture work. There's lots of techniques done really right for making convincing VR, e.g. a tracked torso that moves as you do (as does your shadow), and characters' gazes follow your own. It's easy to get swept away in the narrative, and the game's world is very lively. I initially intended to play just one act then ended up playing through the whole thing from start to finish. Note that this is definitely a movie-like narrative experience first, and a game second.

The presence of animated, fully voice-acted human characters really breathes life into narrative games, even more so in VR. This shouldn't be taken for granted, it's something missing from quite a few VR experiences at this early stage. The characters in FATED are all really well done. I've seen at least one review criticize the voice acting, but that's a problem with video games in general and FATED's voice acting is fine, it's at least better than any Bethesda RPG.

FATED's price is undoubtedly steep for a 1.5 to 2 hour long game. Discounting the economic necessities of developing for a niche, budding or unproven technology, I suppose you could compare the price per unit time to paying a similar amount for going to the cinema with snacks, which provides the "immersion" of a large screen and surround sound, both of which are easily surpassed by VR, where you feel like you're really there,

Some occasional bugs are present but not particularly distruptive and will probably be fixed with time, so my only real criticism is the rune puzzles, which are embarrassingly simple whether they were supposed to be created by humans or giants, and really don't make sense being there. I understand not wanting to stall the narrative by getting the players stuck, but really, were they trying to keep out babies? The game's story, lively world and characters are its strength and it seemed pointless to throw these in. (This was just a criticism of the "puzzles", not the handful of brief action sequences, all of which definitely added to the game.)

FATED is well worth picking up for the experience of dreaming while you're awake, if the price isn't an issue for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025577221', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 261, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 261, 'last_played': 1462055071}
review:
I really wanted to like this game and, maybe after a few updates I will but, for now, I can't recommend it to anyone. The experience is short. Very short. You'll be done in a little over an hour. The previews have made the game look like a lot more  polished experience than it is. Below are the issues which I have encountered.

1. The Game Doesn't Launch in VR Mode - I was unable to run the game on muy HTC VIVE until I set the executable ("jottun.exe") into Windows 7 compatibility mode, which was extremely frustrating to troubleshoot.

2. Poor Controls - This game begs for touch controls but the developers have made a choice to have it work exclusively with a gamepad, maing the expeience a sitting one. As the result, the movement is unpleasant and turning, regardless of the choice of control you make, is either incredibly nauseating (it takes a -LOT- to make me sick in VR. I pretty much never feel even a bit queasy. Using the "natural turning"  ade my stomach swim almost immediately). You are able to make choices and communicate by nodding or shaking your head which is terrific. The rest of the control scheme is clunky and unpleasant to experience.

3. Stiff, "Dead" Characters - though the sence of scale is great and the art style is delightful, the characters animate in a very poor, stiff way, stanidng in default poses, barely moving, except for opening and clothing their mouths and, occasionally, blinking. Everyone just stands there, upright and manequin-like, walking and turning in an awkward way. On the bright side, the character models and environments are beautifull.

4. Uninspired Voice Acting - Voices seem fitting to the characters they come out of but feel stiff, boring and uninteresting. Your character's father's voice is particularly flat, as is the oen belonging to the first distraufght vilager you find upon returning "home".

5. Price - Fot as short, clearly unfinished, and unpolished game, "Fated" costs a lot more than it should. I would -gladly- pay $20 and more for a short yet breathaking and engaging game. I desperately wanted "Fated" to be it and it just wasn't.

If you are looking for a great episodic game on the VIVE, I urge you to try "The Gallery: Call of Starseed" if you want to know what I am talking about here - it's worth every penny and is an unforgettable experience. "Fated", on the other hand is bland, poorly animated and uncomfortable to traverse at this point in time.

review:
Bought this thinking it would last longer than 90mins but it is very short. Will there be more episodes or is this is it....it says episodic but it is not clear if it means the episodes included in the 90 mins or future episodes.

Lot of potential and the fact that they added many ways of combating motion sickness, including snap rotation to a degree of your choice, or fluid rotation with a choice of speed, or on screen comfort markers, is great and i wish all developers would do this as it will eliminate motion sickness for many and is better than teleportation (snap did it for me, or fluid rotation at full speed with tiny taps on the stick also is great as its kind of like snapping but with more control). Sadly, it's very short, so if you are on a budget £14.99 for 90 mins might be to much.

Ich kann das Spiel leider insgesamt nicht empfehlen, obwohl es gute Ansätze hat.

[u]Positive Punkte:[/u]
[list]
[*] Sehr schöne Immersion, man fühlt sich mitten im Geschehen
[*] Für ein VR-Spiel schicke Grafik
[*] Guter Sound / Gute Sprecher
[/list]

[u]Negative Punkte:[/u]
[list]
[*] Sobald man selber gehen kann, sofortige Übelkeit "Motion Sickness"! Sowohl im Snap- als auch Standard-Modus! Das ist der ausschlaggebenste Punkt, warum ich das Spiel nicht empfehle. Ich habe schon sehr viel Spiele in VR gezockt, siehe mein [url=https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC3ok91FKp_SAtxhz63Ti3KQ] Youtube-Kanal [/url], aber nie Motion-Sickness gefühlt, hier hingegen sofort. 
[*] Man muss wirklich genau zuhören (ohne Englisch-Kenntnisse sowieso hoffungslos!) was zu tun ist, denn es gibt keinerlei Hinweise, wo man lang muss oder was zu tun ist.
[*] Man kann nicht rennen?! Zumindest gibt es keine Option dafür im Menü und auch keine der Controller-Tasten hat Rennen ausgelöst. Dies macht das Spiel extrem langwierig und die Laufwege unglaublich nervtötend.
[*] Keine Vive-Controller Unterstützung!
[/list]

Da ich die Motion-Sickness nicht ertrage, musste ich leider einen Refund anfordern.
Warum wird kein Room-Scaling mit Teleport-Funktion unterstützt, da wird einem nicht übel. Warum werden die Vive Controller nicht unterstützt? Mit den zwei steuerbaren Händen des Charakters würde das prima funktionieren! Mit dem Controller wirkt das alles sehr unecht.
